docstr: `LCOBOUND` â€” Lower codimension bounds of an array ### Description Returns the lower bounds of a coarray, or a single lower cobound along the `DIM` codimension. ### Syntax `RESULT = LCOBOUND(COARRAY [, DIM [, KIND]])` ### Arguments | `ARRAY` | Shall be an coarray, of any type. | `DIM` | (Optional) Shall be a scalar `INTEGER`. | `KIND` | (Optional) An `INTEGER` initialization expression indicating the kind parameter of the result. ### Return value The return value is of type `INTEGER` and of kind `KIND`. If `KIND` is absent, the return value is of default integer kind. If `DIM` is absent, the result is an array of the lower cobounds of `COARRAY`. If `DIM` is present, the result is a scalar corresponding to the lower cobound of the array along that codimension. ### Standard Fortran 2008 and later ### Class Inquiry function ### See also UCOBOUND, LBOUND
